DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Pre-1998 Surgery Type Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Field for-pre-1996 surgery codes for COC and pre-1998 surgery codes for SEER.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pre-1996 surgery codes for COC and pre-1998 surgery codes for SEER.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A number with no fractional part.::1998:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pre-1998_A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: See NAACCR Data Dictionary, Eleventh Edition, for instructions.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: RXSumm--Surgery Type Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Surgery codes used 1998 and later can be backward converted into the older codes and the converted value can be stored in this field.  See Chapter V, Unresolved Issues, for discussion of COC/SEER differences in coding treatment.
